item.title: [INDSOYA] SEBI LODR Regulations: Securities Appellate Tribunal Directs Deposit of Rs. 2,06,000 from Apollo Ingredients (Formerly Indsoya Ltd) and Defreezing of Promoters' Demat Accounts
item.description:
The Securities Appellate Tribunal, Mumbai has passed an interim order in the matter of Apollo Ingredients Limited (Formerly Known as Indsoya Limited) versus BSE Limited. The Company had filed an appeal challenging the rejection by BSE Limited of its waiver application in respect of fines imposed by the Exchange. The Tribunal has admitted the appeal, condoned the delay of 69 days, and directed the Company to deposit Rs. 2,06,000 under protest. The Tribunal has also ordered the defreezing of promotersâ€™ demat accounts subject to such deposit. The deposited amount will be kept in an interest-bearing account by BSE and will be subject to the final outcome of the appeal. The matter is listed for further hearing on June 18, 2026. This order does not have any material impact on the financial position, operations, or other activities of the Company, except to the extent of the deposit of Rs. 2,06,000, which remains subject to final adjudication of the Appeal.

  • Securities Appellate Tribunal has admitted the appeal filed by Apollo Ingredients (Formerly Indsoya Ltd) challenging the rejection of its waiver application by BSE Limited
  • The Tribunal has condoned the delay of 69 days and directed the Company to deposit Rs. 2,06,000 under protest

item.description:

Moil Ltd, stock code NSE â€” MOIL, BSE - 533286, has announced a revision in the prices of different grades of Manganese Ore for the month of February 2026, effective from 01.02.2026. The prices of all Ferro grades of manganese ore with Manganese content of Mn- 44% and above, SMGR (Mn-30%), Fines grades, and all Chemical grades have been increased by 5%. The prices of SMGR (Mn 25%) grades, SMGR (Mn 20%) grades, and certain Metal Mandi Fines have been continued from the previous month. The basic price of EMD has also remained unchanged. item.title: [GAIL] Deepak Gupta Assumes Charge as Chairman and Managing Director of Gail (India) Ltd
item.description:
Shri Deepak Gupta, a Mechanical Engineer from Delhi College of Engineering, has taken over as Chairman and Managing Director of Gail (India) Ltd. He has over 35 years of experience in the Oil & Gas value chain and has been leading the execution of multiple high-impact initiatives at GAIL. He also oversees the operation and maintenance of GAIL's vast network of natural gas and LPG pipelines. Gupta has been instrumental in many digital transformation initiatives and has played a pivotal role in strategic goal setting and corporate governance in GAIL's JVs. He has also led many large cross-functional teams to execute landmark projects under complex and challenging conditions.

  • Shri Deepak Gupta assumes charge as Chairman and Managing Director of Gail (India) Ltd.
  • Gupta has over 35 years of experience in the Oil & Gas value chain.
  • He is leading the execution of multiple high-impact initiatives at GAIL.
  • Gupta oversees the operation and maintenance of GAIL's vast network of natural gas and LPG pipelines.
  • He has played a pivotal role in strategic goal setting and corporate governance in GAIL's JVs.

item.title: [ESCORTS] Escorts Kubota Ltd Reports 20.4% Growth in Tractor Sales and 4.8% Rise in Construction Equipment Sales in February 2026
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Escorts Kubota Limited Agri Machinery Business sold 10,339 tractors in February 2026, a 20.4% growth compared to 8,590 tractors sold in February 2025. Domestic tractor sales contributed significantly to the growth with a 22.1% increase. The construction equipment business also experienced a steady growth of 4.8% in February 2026. The positive trend is expected to continue due to favorable government policies, GST reduction, and a promising outlook for the Rabi season.

  • Escorts Kubota Limited reported a 20.4% growth in tractor sales in February 2026
  • Domestic tractor sales increased by 22.1%
  • Construction equipment sales grew by 4.8% in February 2026
  • The positive trend is expected to continue due to favorable government policies and a promising outlook for the Rabi season
  • The company is committed to excellence in engineering, innovation in products, and development of market-relevant technologies
